main event: An orange-red, round object with a tail was observed dropping out of sight at a 45 degree angle in Presque Isle, Maine on 3 October 1956.
interesting points: The object was initially seen at a 45 degree angle and gained speed as it dropped out of sight,The tail of the object was the same size as its body,The observation lasted only two to three seconds,The estimated speed of the object was approximately 1000 MPH,The conclusion of the report suggested it might have been a meteor.
sighted object: an orange-red round object with a tail
witness description: The sighting was recorded by military personnel at Presque Isle AFB.
